name: Carrot and Sweet Potato Soup With Mint or Tarragon
description: This easy, beautiful purée makes a nice Thanksgiving opener, with the added benefit of extra doses of vitamin A, vitamin C, potassium and fiber. If you’re looking to get ahead with your meal, you can make this dish up to two days ahead of the big day.
keywords: carrot, sweet potato, tarragon, fall, healthy, vegetarian, side dish
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon canola oil or unsalted butter
1 pound sweet potatoes, peeled and diced
6 cups water, chicken stock or vegetable stock
1 tablespoon minced fresh mint or tarragon

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oil in a heavy soup pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the shallots. Cook, stirring, until tender, three to five minutes. Add carrots. Cook, stirring often, for five minutes until they begin to soften. Add the sweet potatoes, water or stock, tarragon sprigs and orange zest, and bring to a simmer. Add salt to taste, reduce the heat, cover and simmer 45 minutes or until all of the ingredients are thoroughly tender. Remove the orange zest, and discard.

Purée the soup in batches in a blender, removing the stopper from the top and holding a kitchen towel tightly over the top to avoid splashing, or in a food processor fitted with the steel blade. Return to the pot, heat through, and adjust salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the mint or tarragon, and serve.
